name: Dragon Fruit (Pitaya)
description: Known for its striking appearance and mildly sweet taste, pitaya is a popular choice for smoothies and desserts.

name: Naranjilla (Lulo)
description: This fruit has a tangy, citrus-like flavor and is often used to make refreshing beverages. Its unique taste makes it a favorite in Colombian cuisine.

name: Pineapple Guava (Feijoa)
description: With a flavor that combines pineapple and guava, feijoa is enjoyed fresh or in jams and desserts.

name: Peach Palm Fruit (Chontaduro)
description: This nutritious fruit is commonly eaten boiled and salted or mixed with honey. It has a starchy texture and a slightly sweet taste. Additionally, chontaduro is believed to have aphrodisiac properties.

name: Passion Fruit (Maracuyá)
description: Known for its aromatic, tangy pulp, passion fruit is used in juices, desserts, and sauces. Its refreshing taste makes it a favorite in tropical drinks.

name: Soursop (Guanábana)
description: With a sweet and tart flavor, soursop is often used in beverages, ice creams, and smoothies. It's also known for its potential health benefits.

name: Tree Tomato (Tomate de Árbol)
description: This fruit has a sweet and sour taste, making it ideal for juices, sauces, and salads.

name: Spanish Lime (Mamoncillo)
description: Similar to lychee, mamoncillo has a tangy-sweet flavor and is enjoyed fresh, often eaten directly from the peel.

name: Borojó
description: Known for its high energy content and unique taste, borojó is often used in health drinks and is believed to have aphrodisiac properties.

name: Banana Passion Fruit (Curuba)
description: This fruit has a banana-like texture and a sweet yet tangy flavor, making it perfect for desserts and beverages.
